question: Lord Vader, this is an unexpected pleasure. We're honored by your presence.
answer: You may dispense with the pleasantries, Commander. I'm here to put you back on schedule.

question: I assure you, Lord Vader, my men are working as fast as they can.
answer: Perhaps I can find new ways to motivate them.

question: I tell you, this station will be operational as planned.
answer: The Emperor does not share your optimistic appraisal of the situation.

question: But he asks the impossible. I need more men.
answer: Then perhaps you can tell him when he arrives. That is correct, Commander. And he is most displeased with your apparent lack of progress.

question: We shall double our efforts.
answer: I hope so, Commander, for your sake. The Emperor is not as forgiving as I am.

question: Of course I'm worried. And you should be, too. Lando Calrissian and poor Chewbacca never returned from this awful place. Don't be so sure. If I told you half the things I've heard about this Jabba the Hutt, you'd probably short-circuit. Artoo, are you sure this is the right place? I better knock, I suppose. Goodness gracious me! Artoo Detoowha bo Seethreepiowha ey toota odd mischka Jabba du Hutt. I don't think they're going to let us in, Artoo. We'd better go. Artoo, wait. Oh, dear! Artoo. Artoo, I really don't think we should rush into all this. Oh, Artoo! Artoo, wait for me! Just you deliver Master Luke's message and get us out of here. Oh my! Oh! Oh, no.
answer: Die Wanna Wanga!

question: Oh, my! Die Wanna Wauaga. We -- we bring a message to your master, Jabba the Hutt.
answer: Nee Jabba no badda. Me chaade su goodie.

question: He says that our instructions are to give it only to Jabba himself. I'm terribly sorry. I'm afraid he's ever so stubborn about these sort of things.
answer: Nudd Chaa.

question: What did he say? This can't be! Artoo, you're playing the wrong message. We're doomed. Artoo, look! Captain Solo. And he's still frozen in carbonite. What could possibly have come over Master Luke. Is it something I did? He never expressed any unhappiness with my work. Oh! Oh! Hold it! Ohh!
answer: Ah, good. New acquisitions. You are a protocol droid, are you not?

question: I am See-Threepio, human-cy...
answer: Yes or no will do.

question: Oh. Well, yes.
answer: How many languages do you speak?

question: I am fluent in over six million forms of communication, and can readily...
answer: Splendid! We have been without an interpreter since our master got angry with our last protocol droid and disintegrated him.

question: Disintegrated?
answer: You're a feisty little one, but you'll soon learn some respect. I have need for you on the master's Sail Barge. And I think you'll fit in nicely.

question: Just relax for a moment. You're free of the carbonite. Shhh. You have hibernation sickness.
answer: I can't see.

question: Your eyesight will return in time.
answer: Where am I?

question: Jabba's palace.
answer: Who are you?

question: Who are you?
answer: Someone who loves you.

question: Leia!
answer: I gotta get you out of here.

question: What's that? I know that laugh. Hey, Jabba. Look, Jabba, I was just on my way to pay you back, but I got a little sidetracked. It's not my fault. Look... Jabba... I'll pay you triple! You're throwing away a fortune here. Don't be a fool!
answer: We have powerful friends. You're gonna regret this... Ugh!

question: Han!
answer: Luke!

question: Are you all right?
answer: Fine. Together again, huh?

question: Wouldn't miss it.
answer: How are we doing?

question: The same as always.
answer: That bad, huh? Where's Leia?

question: On second thought, let's pass on that, huh?
answer: You should have bargained, Jabba. That's the last mistake you'll ever make.

question: I think my eyes are getting better. Instead of a big dark blur, I see a big light blur.
answer: There's nothing to see. I used to live here, you know.

question: You're gonna die here, you know. Convenient.
answer: Just stick close to Chewie and Lando. I've taken care of everything.

question: Whoa! Whoa! Help!
answer: Chewie, you okay? Where is he? I'm okay, pal.

question: Han! Chewie?
answer: Lando! Boba Fett?! Boba Fett?! Where? Lando, grab it!

question: Lower it!
answer: I'm trying! Whoa! Whoa! Grab me, Chewie! I'm slipping. Grab it! L--Lando. Grab! Grab it! Almost... You almost got it!

question: Hold it! Whoa!
answer: Gently now. All... all right. Now easy, easy. Hold me, Chewie. Chewie! Chewie, give me the gun. Don't move, Lando.

question: No, wait! I thought you were blind!
answer: It's all right. Trust me. Don't move.

question: All right! A little higher! Just a little higher!
answer: Chewie, Pull us up! Come on! Okay... up, Chewie, up!

question: The Death Star will be completed on schedule.
answer: You have done well, Lord Vader. And now I sense you wish to continue your search for young Skywalker.

question: Yes, my Master.
answer: Patience, my friend. In time he will seek you out. And when he does, you must bring him before me. He has grown strong. Only together can we turn him to the dark side of the Force.

question: As you wish.
answer: Everything is proceeding as I have foreseen.

question: Hmm. That face you make. Look I so old to young eyes?
answer: No... of course not.

question: Soon will I rest. Yes, forever sleep. Earned it, I have.
answer: Master Yoda, you can't die.

question: Strong am I with the Force... but not that strong! Twilight is upon me and soon night must fall. That is the way of things... the way of the Force.
answer: But I need your help. I've come back to complete the training.

question: No more training do you require. Already know you that which you need.
answer: Then I am a Jedi? Master Yoda... is Darth Vader my father?

question: Mmm... rest I need. Yes... rest.
answer: Yoda, I must know.

question: Your father he is. Told you, did he?
answer: Yes.

question: Unexpected this is, and unfortunate...
answer: Unfortunate that I know the truth? Well, I'm sorry.

question: Remember, a Jedi's strength flows from the Force. But beware. Anger, fear, aggression. The dark side are they. Once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny. Luke...Luke...Do not...Do not underestimate the powers of the Emperor, or suffer your father's fate, you will. Luke, when gone am I , the last of the Jedi will you be. Luke, the Force runs strong in your family. Pass on what you have learned, Luke... There is...another...Sky...Sky...walker.
answer: I can't do it, Artoo. I can't go on alone.

question: I can't do it, Artoo. I can't go on alone.
answer: Yoda will always be with you.

question: Obi-Wan! Why didn't you tell me? You told me Vader betrayed and murdered my father.
answer: You father was seduced by the dark side of the Force. He ceased to be Anakin Skywalker and became Darth Vader. When that happened, the good man who was your father was destroyed. So what I have told you was true... from a certain point of view. Luke, you're going to find that many of the truths we cling to depend greatly on our own point of view. I don't blame you for being angry. If I was wrong in what I did, it certainly wouldn't have been for the first time. You see, what happened to your father was my fault. Anakin was a good friend. When I first knew him, your father was already a great pilot. But I was amazed how strongly the Force was with him. I took it upon myself to train him as a Jedi. I thought that I could instruct him just as well as Yoda. I was wrong. My pride has had terrible consequences for the galaxy.

question: There's still good in him.
answer: I also thought he could be turned back to the good side. It couldn't be done. He is more machine now than man. Twisted and evil.

question: I can't do it, Ben.
answer: You cannot escape your destiny.

question: I tried to stop him once. I couldn't do it.
answer: Vader humbled you when first you met him, Luke... but that experience was part of your training. It taught you, among other things, the value of patience. Had you not been so impatient to defeat Vader then, you could have finished your training here with Yoda. You would have been prepared.

question: But I had to help my friends.
answer: To be a Jedi, Luke, you must confront and then go beyond the dark side - the side your father couldn't get past. Impatience is the easiest door - for you, like your father. Only, your father was seduced by what he found on the other side of the door, and you have held firm. You're no longer so reckless now, Luke. You are strong and patient. And now, you must face Darth Vader again!

question: I can't kill my own father.
answer: Then the Emperor has already won. You were our only hope.

question: Yoda spoke of another.
answer: The other he spoke of is your twin sister.

question: But I have no sister.
answer: Hmm. To protect you both from the Emperor, you were hidden from your father when you were born. The Emperor knew, as I did, if Anakin were to have any offspring, they would be a threat to him. That is the reason why your sister remains safely anonymous.

question: Leia! Leia's my sister.
answer: Your insight serves you well. Bury your feelings deep down, Luke. They do you credit. But they could be made to serve the Emperor.

question: But you can't let her get involved now, Ben. Vader will destroy her.
answer: She hasn't been trained in the ways of the Jedi the way you have, Luke... but the Force is strong with her, as it is with all of your family. There is no avoiding the battle. You must face and destroy Vader!

question: What is thy bidding, my Master?
answer: Send the fleet to the far side of Endor. There it will stay until called for.

question: What of the reports of the Rebel fleet massing near Sullust?
answer: It is of no concern. Soon the Rebellion will be crushed and young Skywalker will be one of us! Your work here is finished, my friend. Go out to the command ship and await my orders.

question: It'll work. It'll work.
answer: Vader's on that ship.

question: Now don't get jittery, Luke. There are a lot of command ships. Keep your distance though, Chewie, but don't look like you're trying to keep your distance. I don't know. Fly casual.
answer: I'm endangering the mission. I shouldn't have come.

question: The Emperor will see me, now!
answer: I told you to remain on the command ship.

question: A small Rebel force has penetrated the shield and landed on Endor. I have felt him, my Master.
answer: Strange, that I have not. I wonder if your feelings on this matter are clear, Lord Vader.

question: They are clear, my Master.
answer: Then you must go to the Sanctuary Moon and wait for them. I have foreseen it. His compassion for you will be his undoing. He will come to you and then you will bring him before me.

question: What, Chewie? What? Chewie! Hey, I don't get it.
answer: Chewie, wa-wait! Don't!

question: Nice work. Great, Chewie! Great! Always thinking with your stomach.
answer: Will you take it easy? Let's just figure out a way to get out of this thing. Han, can you reach my lightsaber?

question: Oh, yes, Master Luke! Remember that I am fluent in over six million forms of communication.
answer: What are you telling them?

question: Hello, I think... I could be mistaken. They're using a very primitive dialect. But I do believe they think I am some sort of god.
answer: Well, why don't you use your divine influence and get us out of this?

question: I beg your pardon, General Solo, but that just wouldn't be proper.
answer: Proper?!

question: It's against my programming to impersonate a deity.
answer: Why, you-- My mistake. He's an old friend of mine. I have a really bad feeling about this. What did he say?

question: Threepio, tell them if they don't do as you wish, you'll become angry and use your magic.
answer: But Master Luke, what magic? I couldn't possibly --

question: Just tell them.
answer: You see, Master Luke; they didn't believe me. Just... ... as I said they wouldn't. Wha-wha-what's happening! Oh! Oh, dear! Oh! Put me down! He-e-elp! Master Luke! Artoo! Somebody, somebody, help! Master Luke, Artoo! Artoo, quickly! Do something, somebody! Oh! Ohhh! Oh, oh, oh, oh! Thank goodness.

question: Thanks, Threepio.
answer: Yes, Artoo. I was just coming to that.

question: Luke, what's wrong?
answer: Leia... do you remember your mother? Your real mother?

question: Just a little bit. She died when I was very young.
answer: What do you remember?

question: Just...images, really. Feelings.
answer: Tell me.

question: She was very beautiful. Kind, but...sad. Why are you asking me all this?
answer: I have no memory of my mother. I never knew her.

question: Luke, tell me. What's troubling you?
answer: Vader is here...now, on this moon. I felt his presence. He's come for me. He can feel when I'm near. That's why I have to go. As long as I stay, I'm endangering the group and our mission here. I have to face him.

question: Why?
answer: He's my father.

question: Your father?
answer: There's more. It won't be easy for you to hear it, but you must. If I don't make it back, you're the only hope for the Alliance.

question: Luke, don't talk that way. You have a power I--I don't understand and could never have.
answer: You're wrong, Leia. You have that power too. In time you'll learn to use it as I have. The Force is strong in my family. My father has it...I have it...and...my sister has it. Yes. It's you Leia.

question: I know. Somehow...I've always known.
answer: Then you know why I have to face him.

question: No! Luke, run away, far away. If he can feel your presence, then leave this place. I wish I could go with you.
answer: No, you don't. You've always been strong.

question: But, why must you confront him?
answer: Because...there is good in him. I've felt it. He won't turn me over to the Emperor. I can save him. I can turn him back to the good side. I have to try.

question: The Emperor has been expecting you.
answer: I know, father.

question: So, you have accepted the truth.
answer: It is the name of your true self. You've only forgotten. I know there is good in you. The Emperor hasn't driven it from you fully. That is why you couldn't destroy me. That's why you won't bring me to your Emperor now.

question: Your skills are complete. Indeed, you are powerful, as the Emperor has foreseen.
answer: Come with me.

question: Obi-Wan once thought as you do. You don't know the power of the dark side. I must obey my master.
answer: I will not turn...and you'll be forced to kill me.

question: If that is your destiny.
answer: Search your feelings, father. You can't do this. I feel the conflict within you. Let go of your hate.

question: It is too late for me, son. The Emperor will show you the true nature of the Force. He is your master now.
answer: Then my father is truly dead.

question: Admiral, we're in position. All fighters accounted for.
answer: Proceed with the countdown. All groups assume attack coordinates.

question: Don't worry, my friends are down there. They'll have that shield down on time... or this'll be the shortest offensive of all time.
answer: All craft, prepare to jump to hyperspace on my mark.

question: Well, it only takes one to sound the alarm.
answer: Oh! Oh, my. Uh, Princess Leia!

question: Quiet.
answer: I'm afraid our furry companion has gone and done something rather rash.

question: Ah, yes, a Jedi's weapon. Much like your father's. By now you must know your father can never be turned from the dark side. So will it be with you.
answer: You're wrong. Soon I'll be dead...and you with me.

question: Perhaps you refer to the imminent attack of your Rebel fleet. Yes...I assure you we are quite safe from your friends here.
answer: Your overconfidence is your weakness.

question: All right, move it! I said move it! Go on!
answer: Hello! I say, over there! Were you looking for me?

question: Let's go!
answer: Well, they're on their way. Artoo, are you sure this was a good idea?

question: Freeze! Don't move!
answer: We surrender. Ohhh! Stand back, Artoo.

question: That blast came from the Death Star! That thing's operational! Home One, this is Gold Leader.
answer: We saw it. All craft prepare to retreat.

question: You won't get another chance at this, Admiral.
answer: We have no choice, General Calrissian. Our cruisers can't repel firepower of that magnitude.

question: Obi-Wan has taught you well.
answer: I will not fight you, father.

question: You are unwise to lower your defenses.
answer: Your thoughts betray you, father. I feel the good in you...the conflict.

question: There is no conflict.
answer: You couldn't bring yourself to kill me before, and I don't believe you'll destroy me now.
